main_text:
Challenges to Experimental Philosophy
3. Challenges to Experimental Philosophy

As is the case with any healthy research area, there is lots of
dispute about issues within experimental philosophy. There are
disagreements about particular studies, the implications of different
kinds of results, and so on. But there are also broad challenges to
the very idea that experimental philosophy research could prove
helpful in addressing the philosophical questions. We focus here on
three of the most prominent of these challenges.
